Package be.helha.api_recettapp.services

Class PaypalService

java.lang.Object
be.helha.api_recettapp.services.PaypalService
@Service public class PaypalService extends Object
Service class for integrating with PayPal's API. This service provides functionality to interact with the PayPal API, including obtaining access tokens and creating payments. It uses @Service annotation to mark this class as a Spring service component.

  • Constructor Details

    • PaypalService

      public PaypalService(org.springframework.web.client.RestTemplate restTemplate, @Qualifier("getClientId") String clientId, @Qualifier("getClientSecret") String clientSecret, @Qualifier("getApiUrl") String apiUrl)
      Constructs a new PaypalService.
      Parameters:
      restTemplate - A RestTemplate instance for making HTTP requests.
      clientId - The PayPal client ID, injected using @Qualifier("getClientId").
      clientSecret - The PayPal client secret, injected using @Qualifier("getClientSecret").
      apiUrl - The PayPal API base URL, injected using @Qualifier("getApiUrl").

  • Method Details

    • getAccessToken

      public String getAccessToken()
      Retrieves an access token from PayPal for API authentication. Sends a POST request to the PayPal API's OAuth2 token endpoint with the client credentials to obtain an access token.
      Returns:
      The PayPal access token as a String.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the token retrieval fails or the response is invalid.

    • createPayment

      public String createPayment(double total, String currency, String cancelUrl, String successUrl)
      Creates a payment on PayPal and retrieves the approval URL. Sends a POST request to the PayPal API to create a payment with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      total - The total amount for the payment.
      currency - The currency for the payment (e.g., "USD").
      cancelUrl - The URL to redirect the user to if the payment is canceled.
      successUrl - The URL to redirect the user to if the payment is successful.
      Returns:
      The approval URL for the created payment, which the user must visit to complete the payment.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the payment creation fails or the response is invalid.

    • validatePayment

      public boolean validatePayment(String paymentId, String payerId)
      Validates a PayPal payment by executing the payment using the provided payment ID and payer ID. This method interacts with the PayPal API to execute the payment and checks if the payment has been approved. It sends a request to the PayPal API with the payment ID and payer ID, and based on the response, it determines whether the payment was successfully approved.
      Parameters:
      paymentId - The unique PayPal payment ID associated with the payment to be validated.
      payerId - The PayPal payer ID associated with the payment to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the payment has been successfully approved, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the payment validation fails or the PayPal API returns an error.

    • savePaypalResponse

      public PaypalResponse savePaypalResponse(Long userId, String jsonResponse)
      Saves the PayPal response data associated with a user.

      This method retrieves a user by their ID, creates a new PaypalResponse entity with the provided PayPal response JSON, and associates the response with the retrieved user. The PayPal response is then saved in the database.

      If the user with the given ID does not exist, a RuntimeException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to associate with the PayPal response.
      jsonResponse - The PayPal response JSON to be saved.
      Returns:
      The saved PaypalResponse entity.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the user with the specified ID is not found.
